alert.note: Alert for Echols (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 20 at 9:04AM EST until February 23 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Alapaha River At Statenville affecting Echols County. Additional information is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/forecasts.php?wfo=jax. && ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Alapaha River At Statenville. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon to early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 92.0 feet, Griner Road in Mayday begins to flood. This isolates 10 homes in the area. Flooding along the road subsides 2 to 3 days after the river crests in Statenville or when the river falls below 96 feet. At 100.0 feet, The boat ramp near the gauge and adjacent parking lot are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM EST Monday the stage was 99.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 100.5 feet early Wednesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 100.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
